d.  “It is possible for a woman to have a sexual life unriddled by fear only if
she can be confident that she need not pay for a failure of technology or
judgment (and who among us has never once been swept away in the
heat of a sexual moment?) by taking upon herself the crushing burden
of unchosen motherhood” (82).
